intro: Acourtia dissiticeps, commonly known as the hairy acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and features hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in a rounded shape. Acourtia dissiticeps is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
